greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, the coefficients of the Bell polynomials.
comment: The triangle of coefficients of the inverse Bell polynomials is A268442.
reference: L. Comtet, Advanced combinatorics, The art of finite and infinite expansions, 1974.
link: E. T. Bell, Partition polynomials, Ann. Math., 29 (1927-1928), 38-46.
E. T. Bell, Exponential polynomials, Ann. Math., 35 (1934), 258-277.
formula: E.g.f.: exp( Sum_{k>=1} x_{k}*t^k/k! ), monomials in negative lexicographic order.
example: Replacing the sublists by their sums reduces the triangle to the triangle of the Stirling numbers of second kind (A048993).
mathematica: max = 9; egf = Exp[Sum[x[k]*t^k/k!, {k, 1, max}]]; P = Table[n!* SeriesCoefficient[egf, {t, 0, n}], {n, 0, max-1}]; row[n_] := (s = Split[ Sort[{ Exponent[# /. x[_] -> x, x], #}& /@ (List @@ Expand[P[[n]]])], #1[[1]] == #2[[1]]&]; Join[{0}, #[[All, 2]]& /@ (s /. x[_] -> 1) // Flatten]); row[1] = {1}; Array[row, max] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 08 2016 *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Feb 07 2016
